commit_message:
Get host-level cpu metrics from pypowervm metric cache

This removes the host-level cpu utilization metrics from nova-powervm.
Host-level cpu metrics are being cached at the pypowervm level where
running totals are kept for total cycles, firmware cycles, and user
cycles. The get_host_cpu_stats driver method converts these metrics
into the format expected by nova.

Change-Id: I85798a8baa81e6737674ec819e9f147a4374050d

commit_message:
Set keystone notification topics if ceilometer is enabled

This sets the keystone notification topics only if ceilometer is
enabled. This mitigates the issue of keystone sending notifications
when nobody is receiving them.

Closes-Bug: #1729293
Depends-On: I4dcce73446633c08ea37ba567610eec398094036
Change-Id: I063af5e642388acc180cb8e728481c5a36cc8ddc

By default keystone sends notifications to the 'notifications'
topic. This is consumed by default by ceilometer. However, when
ceilometer is not enabled, rabbitmq accumulates these notifications

commit_message:
Make keystone notification topics configurable

By default keystone sends notifications to the 'notifications'
topic. This is consumed by default by ceilometer. However, when
ceilometer is not enabled, rabbitmq accumulates these notifications
since nothing is consuming them. This results in the queue consuming
rabbitmq's memory.

With this capability, we can now dynamically configure notification
topics depending on the 'keystone_notification_topics' hiera key.

Related-Bug: #1729293
Change-Id: I4dcce73446633c08ea37ba567610eec398094036

subject: Combined backport for LXC container create storage options
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-11-11 00:21:00.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_post_install.yml', 'files/lxc-machinectl.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/lxc-machinectl-template-9e65779a94cb767f.yaml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_create.yml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Combined backport for LXC container create storage options

This change creates a simple LXC create template for machinectl. This
will allow out container create process to use less storage and more
efficently build containers which will speed up operations and
deployments. This also begins to leverage common tools already on the
systems we support there by simplifing how cache is stored, containers
are built and the general management of images within a host.

The new lxc container create template, and the features it provides,
will only impact new containers created allowing deployers to safely
adopt this change in any existing environment.

When using the ZFS storage type the lxc_container_zfs_root_name needs to
be defined. This change simply sets the option by default.

In order to use a BTRFS container backend a container must be spawned
and ready like other COW backed container storage options. This change
adds a task for BTRFS backends following our existing pattern.

The cross project gating has been disabled until the lxc-hosts patch 
merges. Once the dependent patch is merged we can re-enable the cross
project gate to ensure better, more complete, test coverage is available
within our Pike release. 

(cherry picked from commit 555c8a1bf1e4ee5b823b12d1f201e6a5fac8477c)
(cherry picked from commit aeb9c6e99456eb31af742bb2ee024ead5ba361d8)
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bc0688e5314fede4481d2aac1ddabc3b3bbd9)
(cherry picked from commit 43499ead9fb226b32009720d4f14ddab0a5dd0fd)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ia022a9e8bc7eefa4dcdc1c83c75cd4ad454a78ee
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Combined backport for LXC container create storage options

This change creates a simple LXC create template for machinectl. This
will allow out container create process to use less storage and more
efficently build containers which will speed up operations and
deployments. This also begins to leverage common tools already on the
systems we support there by simplifing how cache is stored, containers
are built and the general management of images within a host.

The new lxc container create template, and the features it provides,
will only impact new containers created allowing deployers to safely
adopt this change in any existing environment.

When using the ZFS storage type the lxc_container_zfs_root_name needs to
be defined. This change simply sets the option by default.

In order to use a BTRFS container backend a container must be spawned
and ready like other COW backed container storage options. This change
adds a task for BTRFS backends following our existing pattern.

The cross project gating has been disabled until the lxc-hosts patch 
merges. Once the dependent patch is merged we can re-enable the cross
project gate to ensure better, more complete, test coverage is available
within our Pike release. 

(cherry picked from commit 555c8a1bf1e4ee5b823b12d1f201e6a5fac8477c)
(cherry picked from commit aeb9c6e99456eb31af742bb2ee024ead5ba361d8)
(cherry picked from commit 4b5bc0688e5314fede4481d2aac1ddabc3b3bbd9)
(cherry picked from commit 43499ead9fb226b32009720d4f14ddab0a5dd0fd)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Ia022a9e8bc7eefa4dcdc1c83c75cd4ad454a78ee
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-09 14:49:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Fix changes-since search filter

In a previous commit which enabled some whitelisting, this bit of the
search was broken.  When the changes-since search filter is triggered,
if a poorly formatted datetime stamp comes through from the user, the
API was returning a 500 due to an exception not being caught, instead of
a 400 as documented by tempest and
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-servers.  This
patch reverts the bit of the whitelist patch that seemed to have
incorrectly removed a wrap around the changes-since filter, which caused
it to fail to catch the exception and properly re-raise a 400.

Change-Id: I7accd89397498fc98ac72825194188434901dedc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix changes-since search filter

In a previous commit which enabled some whitelisting, this bit of the
search was broken.  When the changes-since search filter is triggered,
if a poorly formatted datetime stamp comes through from the user, the
API was returning a 500 due to an exception not being caught, instead of
a 400 as documented by tempest and
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-servers.  This
patch reverts the bit of the whitelist patch that seemed to have
incorrectly removed a wrap around the changes-since filter, which caused
it to fail to catch the exception and properly re-raise a 400.

Change-Id: I7accd89397498fc98ac72825194188434901dedc

subject: Remove superfluous role_name arguments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-10 09:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['spec/identity_registration_spec.rb', 'recipes/identity_registration.rb'], 'message': "Remove superfluous role_name arguments

This patch removes the role_name when using openstack_user's :create
action (it gets ignored by the target method).

Note that the spec test would still pass if only the line in
identity_registration.rb (but not the test) were changed, because the
code that actually does grant the role to the resource is executed right
after user creation and before any tests check the resource for the
existence of the role_name attribute. In other words: if the argument
were required in a call but only supplied in another call, the spec
tests would not catch it. Something to watch out for.

Change-Id: I6d98e0603cc4d8fa2dd21cd402adbbe888fbe4f3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove superfluous role_name arguments

This patch removes the role_name when using openstack_user's :create
action (it gets ignored by the target method).

Note that the spec test would still pass if only the line in
identity_registration.rb (but not the test) were changed, because the
code that actually does grant the role to the resource is executed right
after user creation and before any tests check the resource for the
existence of the role_name attribute. In other words: if the argument
were required in a call but only supplied in another call, the spec
tests would not catch it. Something to watch out for.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-01 16:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Don't rewrite resource_registry values that aren't paths

If you map to e.g OS::Heat::None, the current code adds an unwanted
path prefix to these entries if the environment triggers this legacy
fallback path (e.g it references files outside of tht_root).

Change-Id: Id591c1a119c3471b599dcaddb363f3d353d25fff
Closes-Bug: #1729039
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rewrite resource_registry values that aren't paths

If you map to e.g OS::Heat::None, the current code adds an unwanted
path prefix to these entries if the environment triggers this legacy
fallback path (e.g it references files outside of tht_root).

Change-Id: Id591c1a119c3471b599dcaddb363f3d353d25fff
Closes-Bug: #1729039

commit_message:
Add Django OpenStack Auth to Horizon

Moves Django OpenStack Auth content to Horizon, since they are so
tightly coupled. This cleans up the development workflow and should
make keystone / auth related contributions easier.

Implements: blueprint merge-openstack-auth
Change-Id: Ia1cdc47bad1ca6e633073a9f9445b0c7f70d05bc

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-11-07 08:32:55.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps.yaml', 'environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps-docker.yaml'], 'message': 'Update ansible before the ansible upgrade tasks

In case an ansible update is available during the upgrade then
the ansible package gets updated to a new version by the ansible
tasks. This could potentially lead to issues as the one described
in LP#1729546. This change updates the ansible package via yum
before starting the ansible upgrade tasks in order to avoid having
ansible updating itself.

Related-bug: 1729546

Change-Id: I2ea0aa1f670053578996018663c9fa52dec14b77
'}]
commit_message:
Update ansible before the ansible upgrade tasks

In case an ansible update is available during the upgrade then
the ansible package gets updated to a new version by the ansible
tasks. This could potentially lead to issues as the one described
in LP#1729546. This change updates the ansible package via yum
before starting the ansible upgrade tasks in order to avoid having
ansible updating itself.

Related-bug: 1729546

Change-Id: I2ea0aa1f670053578996018663c9fa52dec14b77

subject: Ignore missing rendered heat envs in prepare
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 16515, 'name': 'mbu', 'email': 'mat.bultel@gmail.com', 'username': 'matbu'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-11-09 10:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/container_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_container_image.py'], 'message': 'Ignore missing rendered heat envs in prepare

Since we use j2 templates for some of the heat environments, and at the
moment they are rendered when uploading them to swift at the beginning
of the deployment workflow, it is possible that one of the heat
environment file passed to the prepare command is, or references a file
that is, not yet rendered.

This commit implements a custom object_request() function that makes
process_multiple_environments_and_files() ignore the missing files.

Change-Id: I6f31898ca3db9563d3d8e8e6e0a9f0cdaebf24ca
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Hervé <therve@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1730650
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore missing rendered heat envs in prepare

Since we use j2 templates for some of the heat environments, and at the
moment they are rendered when uploading them to swift at the beginning
of the deployment workflow, it is possible that one of the heat
environment file passed to the prepare command is, or references a file
that is, not yet rendered.

This commit implements a custom object_request() function that makes
process_multiple_environments_and_files() ignore the missing files.

Change-Id: I6f31898ca3db9563d3d8e8e6e0a9f0cdaebf24ca
Co-Authored-By: Thomas Hervé <therve@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1730650

commit_message:
Create dedicated "apache" base profile

This profile has multiple purposes:
- group common httpd configurations/instructions
- correct a small issue with the "status" mod

Until now, only Horizon was specifically including this mode, and as
httpd wasn't listening on localhost, it wasn't in use at all.

With this commit, all API using apache will be able to provide the httpd
server status on 127.0.0.1/server-status.

Change-Id: If6d64f807c244d7e56852a67ac7dbad26c4c002f
Closes-Bug: 1724751

commit_message:
Limit legacy pbr peridioc runs

These jobs run on the feature/0.10 branch and fail. The v2 jobs run on
master only, so run the job under v3 under master only as well.

Example:
http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack-dev/pbr/feature/0.10/legacy-pbr-installation-dsvm/44aa315/

Change-Id: I0ee95b78ae2ee593998d072fa0b69cefe9f94f8c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-09-28 11:35:51.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/handlers.py'], 'message': 'Make journald use context info for metadata

In cases like the journald handled, where the user and project
attributes are usable for metadata, we need to set the attributes
explicitly in order for the handler to take them into use.

oslo.log already fills up the context information; however, only the
user_identity attribute is currently used as part of the log message.
However, the journald handler can take the values explicitly and set
them up as metadata, which requires less parsing and is easier for
external logging systems to use.

Change-Id: I9d0b47ad3498f7187acb136576fbc805e2e76a5a
Closes-Bug: #1718935
'}]
commit_message:
Make journald use context info for metadata

In cases like the journald handled, where the user and project
attributes are usable for metadata, we need to set the attributes
explicitly in order for the handler to take them into use.

oslo.log already fills up the context information; however, only the
user_identity attribute is currently used as part of the log message.
However, the journald handler can take the values explicitly and set
them up as metadata, which requires less parsing and is easier for
external logging systems to use.

Change-Id: I9d0b47ad3498f7187acb136576fbc805e2e76a5a
Closes-Bug: #1718935

subject: Normalize sorting
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-10-30 19:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/v2/api.py', 'mistral/utils/rest_utils.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlalchemy_db_api.py'], 'message': "Normalize sorting

The idea behind this patch is to disable default sorting for inner
listing operation, because it's not requred there, and leave it
only for api calls.

With this patch we also remove two unnecessary auxiliary functions from
db api: _get_collection_sorted_by_time and _get_collection_sorted_by_name.
Currently they are used to specify default parameters for 'sort_keys',
but unfortunately they do it wrong, which leads to confusion and
incorrect behavior of the system, when _get_collection_sorted_by_name
is used to sort by time [1], when mutable is passed as a default
parameter value and then modified in the code[2][3] (this is one of the
most famous python anti-patterns [4]).

To cope with non-determinism in tests instead of assertEqual method we use
_assert_single_item, which allows to check results regardless of their
order.

Therefore, the patch allows to increase the performance of Mistral and make
the code cleaner.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L528-L539
[2] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L235
[3] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L183-L184
[4] https://docs.quantifiedcode.com/python-anti-patterns/correctness/mutable_default_value_as_argument.html

Change-Id: Ib4380f883969cab4ab851cd910c830e5ce30dfe5
"}]
commit_message:
Normalize sorting

The idea behind this patch is to disable default sorting for inner
listing operation, because it's not requred there, and leave it
only for api calls.

With this patch we also remove two unnecessary auxiliary functions from
db api: _get_collection_sorted_by_time and _get_collection_sorted_by_name.
Currently they are used to specify default parameters for 'sort_keys',
but unfortunately they do it wrong, which leads to confusion and
incorrect behavior of the system, when _get_collection_sorted_by_name
is used to sort by time [1], when mutable is passed as a default
parameter value and then modified in the code[2][3] (this is one of the
most famous python anti-patterns [4]).

To cope with non-determinism in tests instead of assertEqual method we use
_assert_single_item, which allows to check results regardless of their
order.

Therefore, the patch allows to increase the performance of Mistral and make
the code cleaner.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L528-L539
[2] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L235
[3] https://github.com/openstack/mistral/blob/stable/pike/mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/api.py#L183-L184
[4] https://docs.quantifiedcode.com/python-anti-patterns/correctness/mutable_default_value_as_argument.html

Change-Id: Ib4380f883969cab4ab851cd910c830e5ce30dfe5

commit_message:
Optionally search for world-writable files

The search for world-writable files is very intensive and causes
some long delays when running playbooks. This patch makes it
optional and updates the documentation to match.

Change-Id: I206f75597c48023a889bd7027daff2eff82b1a16
(cherry picked from commit a84b6847fc98ba7d5da3fba0f9579ca0671119c3)

subject: Replace 'None' values with empy lists
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-13 10:04:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/utils/settings.py'], 'message': 'Replace 'None' values with empy lists

As was discussed in the comments to change request 517149 [1]
it was decided that exception in get_xstatic_dirs function
should arise in case of 'None' values in BASE_XSTATIC_MODULES list.

In this change request all 'None' values were replaced with empty
lists to avoid exceptions during package build:
"""
Exception occurred:
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/openstack_dashboard/utils/\
    settings.py", line 263, in get_xstatic_dirs
    for file in files:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
"""

[1] https://review.openstack.org/517149

Change-Id: I106450f8b7df0e40635bbfae15a9d48634b7ee02
'}]
commit_message:
Replace 'None' values with empy lists

As was discussed in the comments to change request 517149 [1]
it was decided that exception in get_xstatic_dirs function
should arise in case of 'None' values in BASE_XSTATIC_MODULES list.

In this change request all 'None' values were replaced with empty
lists to avoid exceptions during package build:
"""
Exception occurred:
  File "/<<PKGBUILDDIR>>/openstack_dashboard/utils/\
    settings.py", line 263, in get_xstatic_dirs
    for file in files:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

This patch implements a performance improvement while cloning a
generic volume group from a source group with a snapshot – now the
user doesn’t need to wait until a full copy is done; the newly cloned
volumes will be available for Read/Write as soon as the snapvx link
has been established.
This patch also implements rollback in case of failure while doing

Closes-Bug: 1713957
Change-Id: Ib0b122cdacf17ad99f1eae84ce1e084006f4b053
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Generic volume group clone performance improvements

This patch implements a performance improvement while cloning a
generic volume group from a source group with a snapshot – now the
user doesn’t need to wait until a full copy is done; the newly cloned
volumes will be available for Read/Write as soon as the snapvx link
has been established.
This patch also implements rollback in case of failure while doing
the clone.

Closes-Bug: 1713957
Change-Id: Ib0b122cdacf17ad99f1eae84ce1e084006f4b053

commit_message:
Fix prometheus scrape configuration

Make prometheus configuration compatible with 1.7.3 or greater.
The new config matches the one in the pormetheus kubernetes
example [1] minus the configuration for ingress that we don't
deploy.

[1] https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/blob/master/documentation/examples/prometheus-kubernetes.yml
Closes-Bug: #1719187

Change-Id: Ied8b8d8fb610e5ecba18e37f98dd1a4c9bddbf30

subject: ignore changes until the file is added within the scanned range
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-10 16:23:46.000000000', 'files': ['reno/scanner.py', 'reno/tests/test_scanner.py'], 'message': 'ignore changes until the file is added within the scanned range

Ignore changes to a note file until the scanner encounters the git
operation that adds the file. This ensures that if a file is modified
on master when it should be modified on another branch the note is not
incorporated into the notes for the next release from master.

Change-Id: I4e41c482695e93ebb5a73866c432636201a7534f
Fixes-Bug: #1682796
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ignore changes until the file is added within the scanned range

Ignore changes to a note file until the scanner encounters the git
operation that adds the file. This ensures that if a file is modified
on master when it should be modified on another branch the note is not
incorporated into the notes for the next release from master.

Change-Id: I4e41c482695e93ebb5a73866c432636201a7534f
Fixes-Bug: #1682796
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Switch integration jobs to use local mirrors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-03 07:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/pre_test_hook.sh', 'heat_integrationtests/cleanup_test_env.sh', 'heat_integrationtests/prepare_test_env.sh'], 'message': "Switch integration jobs to use local mirrors

The integration jobs currently download images from a third party
mirror which can be slow at times or use up a lot of bandwidth.

This patch tries to automatically detect if nodepool mirrors are
active and uses them, falling back to the global round-robin mirror
of the Fedora project instead of a specific mirror.

Note: Though there is no bug associated with this change, we need to
backport this to avoid future issues (most of the mirrors don't host
Fedora 24 images any more)


Change-Id: Ie111c20b6dd0efe2e1cbfcac2a46b27ce6bc20c0
(cherry picked from commit a47e342f4d0cad4ff314a3f546b6661c8ec67777)
"}]
commit_message:
Switch integration jobs to use local mirrors

The integration jobs currently download images from a third party
mirror which can be slow at times or use up a lot of bandwidth.

This patch tries to automatically detect if nodepool mirrors are
active and uses them, falling back to the global round-robin mirror
of the Fedora project instead of a specific mirror.

Note: Though there is no bug associated with this change, we need to
backport this to avoid future issues (most of the mirrors don't host
Fedora 24 images any more)


Change-Id: Ie111c20b6dd0efe2e1cbfcac2a46b27ce6bc20c0
(cherry picked from commit a47e342f4d0cad4ff314a3f546b6661c8ec67777)

subject: Fix Horizon asset compression not happening on redeploy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-12 04:32:09.000000000', 'files': ['docker/horizon/extend_start.sh'], 'message': 'Fix Horizon asset compression not happening on redeploy

A recent change to kolla-ansible (a729dcc4) bind mounts /tmp from the
host to handle uploading of larger images. Unfortunately this is also
where we keep the state file for horizon which controls whether assets
need to be recompressed (.local_settings.md5sum.txt). This means it is
left over on destroy and causes issues with CSS / assets on redeploy.

Change the location of this file to
/var/lib/kolla/.local_settings.md5sum.txt so it is cleaned up correctly
along with the container.

Change-Id: Icfc71266cabedc2c1a3d30590cada3f774bc0d2c
Closes-Bug: #1721281
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Horizon asset compression not happening on redeploy

A recent change to kolla-ansible (a729dcc4) bind mounts /tmp from the
host to handle uploading of larger images. Unfortunately this is also
where we keep the state file for horizon which controls whether assets
need to be recompressed (.local_settings.md5sum.txt). This means it is
left over on destroy and causes issues with CSS / assets on redeploy.

Change the location of this file to
/var/lib/kolla/.local_settings.md5sum.txt so it is cleaned up correctly
along with the container.

Change-Id: Icfc71266cabedc2c1a3d30590cada3f774bc0d2c
Closes-Bug: #1721281

commit_message:
Add --bypass-url option.

Adding --bypass-url option to setup endpoint URL. This option very
required for debugging on production server, allows you to exclude
balancers (like haproxy).

Change-Id: Ibded42948543a80fb4f31a7763a01261f2bd8fb5

commit_message:
Do not update the container registry if is None

If the variable self.container_registry is None
then it will break, we should handle this error.

This review is related to the LP:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1730687

Change-Id: I9266e0d143c8caa00cb615d35ac808af168b87f2
Closes-Bug: #1730687

When the init minor update step is run without any

an exception. We should accept to run it, even if
the container won't be update. It could be usefull

Closes-Bug: #1730687

commit_message:
Do not failed update if no container registry is set

When the init minor update step is run without any
container registry file, the cli should not raise
an exception. We should accept to run it, even if
the container won't be update. It could be usefull
for only run package update on the env.

Change-Id: I73d86d1ec61b9bb6d5f4a5ea8a9bc545ac963420
Closes-Bug: #1730687

resolve this.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-06 15:41:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/cmd/netns_cleanup.py'], 'message': "Remove eventlet dependency from wait_until_true

As wait_until_true cannot be used with oslo rootwrap daemon (see bug
1654287 for more information), this patch replaces wait_until_true()
function with simplified implementation. The function is heavily used in
testing areas and having eventlet causes problems.

As a side effect, we can move the function to neutron-lib as we've
already attempted several times in the past.

Change-Id: I5c7b1d12acf0ba7a0a80b835ae929e962072bd81
Closes-bug: #1721796
Related-bug: #1654287
"}]
commit_message:
Remove eventlet dependency from wait_until_true

As wait_until_true cannot be used with oslo rootwrap daemon (see bug
1654287 for more information), this patch replaces wait_until_true()
function with simplified implementation. The function is heavily used in
testing areas and having eventlet causes problems.

As a side effect, we can move the function to neutron-lib as we've
already attempted several times in the past.

Change-Id: I5c7b1d12acf0ba7a0a80b835ae929e962072bd81
Closes-bug: #1721796
Related-bug: #1654287

commit_message:
rest_client: Make body optional for PUT

Actions on some resource are triggered with PUT but doesn't necessarily
require a body. This patch makes body optional for PUT operation.

Change-Id: Iddb1520d9d076c0d96b6b378536a91738495be17
Closes-bug: #1706985

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-10 09:08:48.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/profiles/os/heat/stack.py', 'senlin/profiles/os/nova/server.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_nova_server.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/profiles/test_heat_stack.py'], 'message': 'move physical_id check from engine object to profile layer

this patch revise node deletion process to move physical_id check
to profile layer, so that users could have more change to customize
this process.

for some cases we may not have the physical_id, but the server is
running in nova, or somewhere. In this cases, we may need to delete

Change-Id: If0759561cca32aa39efa3245960d03a70219b963
'}]
commit_message:
move physical_id check from engine object to profile layer

this patch revise node deletion process to move physical_id check
to profile layer, so that users could have more change to customize
this process.

for some cases we may not have the physical_id, but the server is
running in nova, or somewhere. In this cases, we may need to delete
server by server_name or metadata.

Change-Id: If0759561cca32aa39efa3245960d03a70219b963

subject: Add delete_port to abstract GenericSwitchDevice
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-11 14:38:04.000000000', 'files': ['networking_generic_switch/tests/unit/test_devices.py', 'networking_generic_switch/devices/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add delete_port to abstract GenericSwitchDevice

Currently, the delete port method is missing from GenericSwitchDevice.
This method is called by the mechanism driver and should be implemented
by everyone extending GenericSwitchDevice.

This commit adds the signature for delete_port. Additionally, an error
was found in a test implementation of plug_port_to_network where port_id
and segmentation_id were swapped. It was fixed.

Change-Id: I59b949c200c4ff4007dc0d676ac176f900d67316
'}]
commit_message:
Add delete_port to abstract GenericSwitchDevice

Currently, the delete port method is missing from GenericSwitchDevice.
This method is called by the mechanism driver and should be implemented
by everyone extending GenericSwitchDevice.

This commit adds the signature for delete_port. Additionally, an error
was found in a test implementation of plug_port_to_network where port_id
and segmentation_id were swapped. It was fixed.

Change-Id: I59b949c200c4ff4007dc0d676ac176f900d67316

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-27 01:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'cinder/scheduler/filters/capacity_filter.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_filters.py'], 'message': 'Fix adjusted_free_virtual in CapacityFilter

There are two ways to calculate adjusted_free_virtual
in CapacityFilter.

Take mosr as backend_state.max_over_subscription_ratio

adjusted_free_virtual1 = free * mosr
= (total - used - reserved*total)*mosr
= total(1-reserved)*mosr - used*mosr:
eg:  total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 0TB
     free = total - used - total*reserved = 1TB
     adjusted_free_virtual1 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 0 = 2TB
because of used = 0, when a lot of volume to be creating,
they all see 1TB adjusted_free_virtual.

adjusted_free_virtual2 = cinder.utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity
= total*mosr - provisioned - reserved*mosr
= total(1-reserved)*mosr - provisioned:
eg:  total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 1TB
     free = total - free - total*reserved = 1TB - 1TB - 0= 0
     adjusted_free_virtual2 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 1TB = 1TB > 0 = free
but there are no space left on the pool or backend.

For provisioned > used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 > adjusted_free_virtual2.
For provisioned < used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 < adjusted_free_virtual2.
For provisioned = used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 = adjusted_free_virtual2.

adjusted_free_virtual = min(adjusted_free_virtual1, adjusted_free_virtual2)
will solve above problems.

Change-Id: I82e1ad675b2b8639ed6696fb49cb9bc3cb55e29a
Closes-Bug: #1719568
'}]
commit_message:
Fix adjusted_free_virtual in CapacityFilter

There are two ways to calculate adjusted_free_virtual
in CapacityFilter.

Take mosr as backend_state.max_over_subscription_ratio

adjusted_free_virtual1 = free * mosr
= (total - used - reserved*total)*mosr
= total(1-reserved)*mosr - used*mosr:
eg:  total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 0TB
     free = total - used - total*reserved = 1TB
     adjusted_free_virtual1 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 0 = 2TB
because of used = 0, when a lot of volume to be creating,
they all see 1TB adjusted_free_virtual.

adjusted_free_virtual2 = cinder.utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity
= total*mosr - provisioned - reserved*mosr
= total(1-reserved)*mosr - provisioned:
eg:  total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 1TB
     free = total - free - total*reserved = 1TB - 1TB - 0= 0
     adjusted_free_virtual2 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 1TB = 1TB > 0 = free
but there are no space left on the pool or backend.

For provisioned > used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 > adjusted_free_virtual2.
For provisioned < used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 < adjusted_free_virtual2.
For provisioned = used*mosr,
    adjusted_free_virtual1 = adjusted_free_virtual2.

adjusted_free_virtual = min(adjusted_free_virtual1, adjusted_free_virtual2)
will solve above problems.

Change-Id: I82e1ad675b2b8639ed6696fb49cb9bc3cb55e29a
Closes-Bug: #1719568

commit_message:
Fix gnocchiclient creation

Gnocchiclient uses keystoneauth1.adapter so that adapter_options
need to be given.
This patch fixes gnocchiclient creation.

Change-Id: I6b5d8ee775929f4b3fd30be3321b378d19085547
Closes-Bug: #1714871

commit_message:
Fix calculate_virtual_free_capacity

The reserved capacity in utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity should
be multiplied by the over subscription ratio.

Change-Id: I4c9f2bd4521b4b56c63441bb1ae0eb5ed8a76a15
Closes-Bug: #1719504

commit_message:
Fix free_capacity

There are two ways to calculate free_capacity.

Take mosr as backend_state.max_over_subscription_ratio

free_capacity1 = free * mosr
 = (total - used - reserved*total)*mosr
 = total(1-reserved)*mosr - used*mosr:
 eg: total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 0TB
     free = total - used - total*reserved = 1TB - 0 - 0 = 1TB
     free_capacity1 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 0 = 2TB
     because of used = 0, when a lot of volume to be creating,
     they all see 1TB free_capacity.

free_capacity2
 = cinder.utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity
 = total*mosr - provisioned - reserved*mosr
 = total(1-reserved)*mosr - provisioned:
 eg: total = 1TB
     reserved = 0
     mosr = 2
     provisioned = 1TB
     used = 1TB
     free = total - free - total*reserved = 1TB - 1TB - 0= 0
     free_capacity2 = 1TB(1-0)*2 - 1TB = 1TB > 0 = free
     but there are no space left on the pool or backend.

For provisioned > used*mosr, free_capacity1 > free_capacity2.
For provisioned < used*mosr, free_capacity1 < free_capacity2.
For provisioned = used*mosr, free_capacity1 = free_capacity2.

free_capacity = min(free_capacity1, free_capacity2)
will solve above problems.

Change-Id: Id2f24872401b1a91ed6f37a2b7e234a676fc4d60
Closes-Bug: #1719756

commit_message:
Introduce rsyslog-sidecar container

This is a minimal image that is meant to run besides another container
to output the syslog logs to stdout. It listens on UDP port 514 and
the /sockets/log socket file. It contains a static configuration file
that is merely copied into the container image and is placed in place
of the default configuration for rsyslog.

Co-Authored-By: Lars Kellogg-Stedman <lars@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie87ff4f33111f091f436fe4d079da34da31b0479

subject: Use oslo.messaging's filter_rule for keystone notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-23 09:57:28.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/queue/keystone_listener.py'], 'message': "Use oslo.messaging's filter_rule for keystone notifications

Instead of consuming all notifications and checking each one. We can use
oslo.messaging's filter_rule. As a result, the listener endpoint will
requeue all notifications that it's not concerned with.

In a further step we can stop parsing the notification to make the
listener more efficient.

Change-Id: I46fb840ad7137c7a30ed2e2eee68894421592668
"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo.messaging's filter_rule for keystone notifications

Instead of consuming all notifications and checking each one. We can use
oslo.messaging's filter_rule. As a result, the listener endpoint will
requeue all notifications that it's not concerned with.

In a further step we can stop parsing the notification to make the
listener more efficient.

Change-Id: I46fb840ad7137c7a30ed2e2eee68894421592668

commit_message:
Page the db query when filter instances with IP

Currently all the instances will dump from the db without paging if
filtered by IP as IP address filter can't be applied at the DB layer.
This patch gets intances page by page until get enough instances that
meet the condition.

Change-Id: I2d9135fe249a7dabfa0e7c2a1ff4d502f10adbe2
Closes-Bug: #1646122

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-11-10 15:09:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_allocation_candidates.py'], 'message': 'Test alloc candidates with same RC in cn & shared

This change set adds a couple of failing test cases that demonstrate
holes in the design of GET /allocation_candidates when inventory from
the same resource class is present on both the compute node (the "main"
resource provider) and a shared resource provider.

The example being used is where the compute node has some local disk,
and is also associated with a shared storage pool.  Both the compute
node RP and the shared storage RP will provide inventory of DISK_GB.

Test case test_common_rc demonstrates bug #1724613: when I ask for
DISK_GB in this setup, the shared storage pool is ignored.  I expect to
get two candidates back: one with the storage from the compute node; the
other with the storage from the shared storage pool.  But I actually
only get the former candidate back.

Test case test_common_rc_traits_split shows bug #1724633: that placement
can't tell which traits are supposed to apply to which resources.  In
the above scenario, if the local storage is SSD and the shared storage
is RAID, and I ask for SSD + RAID, I "expect" to get back no hits.  But
I would in fact get back a candidate with the storage from the shared
storage pool, because the cumulative set of traits would satisfy my
requested SSD + RAID.

Note that the two tests are functionally identical (traits are ignored
entirely) until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/479766/ lands.  At that
point, depending on how we decide to implement the code that would deal
with this scenario, the test may fail *differently* until bug #1724613
is fixed.

Related-Bug: #1724613
Related-Bug: #1724633

Change-Id: I42edf102379cf329aa2252ab779a9f945f5fc155
'}]
commit_message:
Test alloc candidates with same RC in cn & shared

This change set adds a couple of failing test cases that demonstrate
holes in the design of GET /allocation_candidates when inventory from
the same resource class is present on both the compute node (the "main"
resource provider) and a shared resource provider.

The example being used is where the compute node has some local disk,
and is also associated with a shared storage pool.  Both the compute
node RP and the shared storage RP will provide inventory of DISK_GB.

Test case test_common_rc demonstrates bug #1724613: when I ask for
DISK_GB in this setup, the shared storage pool is ignored.  I expect to
get two candidates back: one with the storage from the compute node; the
other with the storage from the shared storage pool.  But I actually
only get the former candidate back.

Test case test_common_rc_traits_split shows bug #1724633: that placement
can't tell which traits are supposed to apply to which resources.  In
the above scenario, if the local storage is SSD and the shared storage
is RAID, and I ask for SSD + RAID, I "expect" to get back no hits.  But
I would in fact get back a candidate with the storage from the shared
storage pool, because the cumulative set of traits would satisfy my
requested SSD + RAID.

Note that the two tests are functionally identical (traits are ignored
entirely) until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/479766/ lands.  At that
point, depending on how we decide to implement the code that would deal
with this scenario, the test may fail *differently* until bug #1724613
is fixed.

Related-Bug: #1724613
Related-Bug: #1724633

Change-Id: I42edf102379cf329aa2252ab779a9f945f5fc155

For the sake of code deduplication, LOC reduction, and readability
(improved signal:noise ratio), this change set implements some
convenience methods in AllocationCandidatesTestCase for creation of
placement artifacts such as resource providers, inventory, and
allocations, as well as for extracting and comparing results of
get_allocation_candidates.

This only changes test code; and is just a refactor - no tests are

'}]
commit_message:
Refactor test_allocation_candidates

For the sake of code deduplication, LOC reduction, and readability
(improved signal:noise ratio), this change set implements some
convenience methods in AllocationCandidatesTestCase for creation of
placement artifacts such as resource providers, inventory, and
allocations, as well as for extracting and comparing results of
get_allocation_candidates.

This only changes test code; and is just a refactor - no tests are
added, removed, or substantively changed.

Change-Id: I34527a3b2ac33ec3b1c6cce2c4a2163eea1ada4d

commit_message:
Update group name of cert related options

The group name of cert related options have been changed from
keystone_authtoken to keystone_auth since Ocata[1].

This patch is aim to update them to avoid deprecated warning from oslo.config

[1] https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/conf/keystone.py#L19

Change-Id: Ic86eda5ca936e84da9a813aee8b6ceaa1c90eff7

commit_message:
failed to create health policy in listening model

https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1730296
https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1730332

When using listening model, we may not set the options field which
will be None by default. However we want to get the 'interval' field
from option.

commit_message:
no need to update node when the new_profile_id equals to old one.

How to produce:
cluster.profile = old, node.profile = old

update cluster with profile_only = True, new_profile_id = new:
cluster.profile = new, node.profile = old

then, update cluster with profile_only = False, new_profile_id = old:
there is no need to update node then.

Change-Id: If8ff4feb2886bde88c42303867574e9284f3cd29

commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Id175d21e53671c540479d5739201c0ac1c5dfbfc

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-10-25 19:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/cheesecake-promote-backend.rst', 'specs/newton/cheesecake-promote-backend.rst'], 'message': 'Update cheesecake promotion specification

This version addresses several concerns raised
about the original spec to allow for drivers to
have a chance to update the backend when
replication state and/or cinder.conf changes.

It also allows for modifying more of the db
entries related to replication for the services
when doing promotion.

Blueprint replication-backend-promotion

Change-Id: I268f138fc79ec43d5d1842c14a11a78d9062d49e
'}]
commit_message:
Update cheesecake promotion specification

This version addresses several concerns raised
about the original spec to allow for drivers to
have a chance to update the backend when
replication state and/or cinder.conf changes.

It also allows for modifying more of the db
entries related to replication for the services
when doing promotion.

Blueprint replication-backend-promotion

Change-Id: I268f138fc79ec43d5d1842c14a11a78d9062d49e

commit_message:
Add input type check

zaqar raises 500 erro when create message with integer format body.
Because that json.loads() doesn't check the "integer like" string.

Change-Id: Icafa829fa5f5ce3afcafc40f46c39ea8adcc836d
Cloese-bug: 1731170

subject: Configure *_domain_name to Default by default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-23 00:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/vitrage_keystone_authtoken_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/default_domain-8403fba2483f6a63.yaml', 'manifests/keystone/authtoken.pp'], 'message': 'Configure *_domain_name to Default by default

Keystone v2.0 API was removed so we have no choice but configuring
user_domain_name and project_domain_name otherwise it fallbacks to
Keystone v2.0 and it fails. This patch sets the default value so we make
sure Keystone v3 will be used out of the box for our users.

Change-Id: I722d3d730a57a2106b1e9db99020c475bdd15fb5
'}]
commit_message:
Configure *_domain_name to Default by default

Keystone v2.0 API was removed so we have no choice but configuring
user_domain_name and project_domain_name otherwise it fallbacks to
Keystone v2.0 and it fails. This patch sets the default value so we make
sure Keystone v3 will be used out of the box for our users.

Change-Id: I722d3d730a57a2106b1e9db99020c475bdd15fb5

commit_message:
Fix devmode run of quickstart

Set undercloud inventory before it's used in next playbook.
Fix images update issues and set centos images to newest.
Set 'libguestfs_mode: false' to avoid running virt-customize
on initramfs.

Closes-bug: #1730997

Change-Id: I46dce77166ecb828d4186b3f2ffa56cf9aa9d31e

subject: Generate stestr.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-23 09:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', '.stestr.conf'], 'message': 'Generate stestr.conf

When run functional tests, a warning was raised:

UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD. Please create one
to to replace the .testr.conf.

This patch creates a .stestr.conf file but keep .testr.conf. Will
remove it & its usage when testrepository is completely replaced by
stestr. OpenStack has a long-term plan for this [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491075/

Change-Id: I3507c381551d153fc6ca742b8bd4b8333710580b
'}]
commit_message:
Generate stestr.conf

When run functional tests, a warning was raised:

UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD. Please create one
to to replace the .testr.conf.

This patch creates a .stestr.conf file but keep .testr.conf. Will
remove it & its usage when testrepository is completely replaced by
stestr. OpenStack has a long-term plan for this [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/491075/

commit_message:
ironic-pxe: support pxe uefi mode

Support pxe uefi mode following guide
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-pxe.html

In the meantime, ironic-agent kernel and initramfs does not have to
be provided as precondition under /etc/kolla/config in such mode.
Add condition check as well.

Change-Id: If9721806e2a303ccf248659f2fa5ab1f35c48ed5
Signed-off-by: Zhangfei Gao <zhangfei.gao@linaro.org>

subject: Improve get_subent in local neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2017-11-02 02:33:38.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_local_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/local_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Improve get_subent in local neutron

1. What is the problem?
When adding a member for a load balancer, neutron lbaas checks whether
the members subnet exists. If it does not exist, local neutron creates
one. Currently, local neutron creates subnet with assuming that the
network already exists, leading failure of creating subent.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Before creating a subnet, local neutorn checks whether the network
exist. If not, creating the network, then the subnet.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I276445e53a1c35de9263c8c871e5bf3723b4bcfb
'}]
commit_message:
Improve get_subent in local neutron

1. What is the problem?
When adding a member for a load balancer, neutron lbaas checks whether
the members subnet exists. If it does not exist, local neutron creates
one. Currently, local neutron creates subnet with assuming that the
network already exists, leading failure of creating subent.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Before creating a subnet, local neutorn checks whether the network
exist. If not, creating the network, then the subnet.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I276445e53a1c35de9263c8c871e5bf3723b4bcfb

commit_message:
Stop polling if nova instances goto error

According bug description, if the nova instances goto error, the cluster
building poll still work until timeout. To solve this problem, instance
task status was added in the cluster building poll detection.
Also provide a test case to validate the method.

Change-Id: Id772d5528c93fcd061aa9d2b2e56c89229ad655c
Closes-Bug: #1516763

subject: Fix l3 unit test error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-12 11:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix l3 unit test error

1. What is the problem?
Our l3 unit test fails because of a patch[1] that migrates to use OVO
model for subnet and the model validates whether the ipv6_ra_mode and
ipv6_address_mode fields are set as the enumeration values.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Set ipv6_address_mode and ipv6_ra_mode as "slaac" to meet the requirement.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
N/A

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/af00cbc3d248e7beec3e6e49dda963051b85d496

Change-Id: Icaaaf7fc08eb689dbf4437da9fe0714fcdedc250
'}]
commit_message:
Fix l3 unit test error

1. What is the problem?
Our l3 unit test fails because of a patch[1] that migrates to use OVO
model for subnet and the model validates whether the ipv6_ra_mode and
ipv6_address_mode fields are set as the enumeration values.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Set ipv6_address_mode and ipv6_ra_mode as "slaac" to meet the requirement.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
N/A

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/af00cbc3d248e7beec3e6e49dda963051b85d496

Change-Id: Icaaaf7fc08eb689dbf4437da9fe0714fcdedc250

commit_message:
Add ansible sudo running for Debian family

On Debian and Ubuntu pip install ansible to /usr/local/bin/ansible, whereas
on CentOS the location is /usr/bin/ansible.

Add ansible sudo running entry for Debian family.

Partial-Bug: #1729216
Change-Id: I2b57403128bc103148ae696c219df52590214adc
Signed-off-by: Xinliang Liu <xinliang.liu@linaro.org>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-10 15:44:35.000000000', 'files': ['.coveragerc'], 'message': 'Impove coverage job accuracy

by informing it that we use eventlet for concurrency.

We have many false negative coverage runs, even for changes that
do not touch the code under test, for example in doc only change [1].
According to the coverage documentation, unless we indicate that
we are using an alternate to the thread library for concurrency
we will get "very wrong results." [2]

Set this option correctly.  Also avoid false precision in the
coverage report.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/01/514901/2/check/openstack-tox-cover/6df6369/

[2] https://coverage.readthedocs.io/en/coverage-4.4.1/config.html

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7398a45cdab8aa4191a55cbb86b9e6499b09f021
(cherry picked from commit c22c073734d26398a3608e23d1ddffd015805342)
'}]
commit_message:
Impove coverage job accuracy

by informing it that we use eventlet for concurrency.

We have many false negative coverage runs, even for changes that
do not touch the code under test, for example in doc only change [1].
According to the coverage documentation, unless we indicate that
we are using an alternate to the thread library for concurrency
we will get "very wrong results." [2]

Set this option correctly.  Also avoid false precision in the
coverage report.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/01/514901/2/check/openstack-tox-cover/6df6369/

[2] https://coverage.readthedocs.io/en/coverage-4.4.1/config.html

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7398a45cdab8aa4191a55cbb86b9e6499b09f021

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix share size when creating from snapshot

The ONTAP driver was ignoring the size requested when
creating a share from an existing snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1717263

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-10-27 17:50:22.000000000', 'files': ['roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/overcloud-deploy.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Fix extra newline in deploy command

The generated overcloud-deploy.sh script had an extra newline in the
"openstack overcloud deploy" command. This meant that the last line of
the command was not taking effect, effectively making it so that
$DEPLOY_ENV_YAML and the use of $@ was ignored.

This patch uses jinja's replace() to strip the extra newline.

Closes-Bug: #1705252
Change-Id: I502b8e8ea3317d4b2f6af331fc57f8b6148755ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix extra newline in deploy command

The generated overcloud-deploy.sh script had an extra newline in the
"openstack overcloud deploy" command. This meant that the last line of
the command was not taking effect, effectively making it so that
$DEPLOY_ENV_YAML and the use of $@ was ignored.

This patch uses jinja's replace() to strip the extra newline.

Closes-Bug: #1705252
Change-Id: I502b8e8ea3317d4b2f6af331fc57f8b6148755ee

subject: Incorrect URL for polling heat stack
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-09 12:45:53.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.heattop.js'], 'message': 'Incorrect URL for polling heat stack

There is a "topology" tab in the Horizon page which shows heat stack details.
It shows stack's resource dependencies graph. Horizon polls for stack changes
every few seconds.

Currently these pool requests fail in some environments with errors in the
apache log. This is due to the WEBROOT not being taken into account which would
change the path required. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I894d8ab97bc3f67d408ce2f5496da1570d2fb1d3
Closes-Bug: #1707619
(cherry picked from commit 953cd789a67714d7436f3fdf1979e0eb6b78520b)
'}]
commit_message:
Incorrect URL for polling heat stack

There is a "topology" tab in the Horizon page which shows heat stack details.
It shows stack's resource dependencies graph. Horizon polls for stack changes
every few seconds.

Currently these pool requests fail in some environments with errors in the
apache log. This is due to the WEBROOT not being taken into account which would
change the path required. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I894d8ab97bc3f67d408ce2f5496da1570d2fb1d3
Closes-Bug: #1707619
(cherry picked from commit 953cd789a67714d7436f3fdf1979e0eb6b78520b)

subject: poc of deferred run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-06 16:13:54.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/build.py', 'contrib/deffered/deferred-example/Dockerfile.j2', 'docker/macros.j2', 'contrib/deffered/example/Dockerfile.j2', 'contrib/deffered/deferred-example/extend_start.sh', 'contrib/deffered/example/extend_start.sh', 'kolla/common/config.py'], 'message': 'poc of deferred run

- This patch introduces a pair of macros run and flush.
- This patch adds a new --deferred paramater to kolla-build.
- This patch introduces 2 example docker files that install nano.
  contrib/deffered/example/Dockerfile.j2 has fixed layers and run commands.
  contrib/deffered/deferred-example/Dockerfile.j2 has dynamic layers
  that change based on the --deferred paramater.
- Setting --deferred to false emits RUN lines directly for debug
- The default value is false becasue there is no way to pass
  a paramter to bool vaules ...

build images using the following command to test.
~/kolla/tools/build.py --docker-dir=/home/ubuntu/kolla/contrib/ example

this will produce 2 images with 13 layers each

rebuild images with deferred paramater
~/kolla/tools/build.py --docker-dir=/home/ubuntu/kolla/contrib/ --deferred example

this will produce the example image with 13 layers and the deferred-example
image with 7. otherwise the end  state of the images are the same.
as the non deferred build.

Change-Id: I157f079842d40c7c8c06248f6678254d9b4ce23f
'}]
commit_message:
poc of deferred run

- This patch introduces a pair of macros run and flush.
- This patch adds a new --deferred paramater to kolla-build.
- This patch introduces 2 example docker files that install nano.
  contrib/deffered/example/Dockerfile.j2 has fixed layers and run commands.
  contrib/deffered/deferred-example/Dockerfile.j2 has dynamic layers
  that change based on the --deferred paramater.
- Setting --deferred to false emits RUN lines directly for debug
- The default value is false becasue there is no way to pass
  a paramter to bool vaules ...

build images using the following command to test.
~/kolla/tools/build.py --docker-dir=/home/ubuntu/kolla/contrib/ example

this will produce 2 images with 13 layers each

rebuild images with deferred paramater
~/kolla/tools/build.py --docker-dir=/home/ubuntu/kolla/contrib/ --deferred example

this will produce the example image with 13 layers and the deferred-example
image with 7. otherwise the end  state of the images are the same.
as the non deferred build.

Change-Id: I157f079842d40c7c8c06248f6678254d9b4ce23f

subject: Remove the errored steps after they all responded
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-10-16 22:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/wizard/wizard.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/wizard/wizard.controller.js'], 'message': 'Remove the errored steps after they all responded

Removing steps during the initial loop could cause some issues and race
conditions.

This change makes it so the steps are filtered out after they all responded.
Since it waits for the global resolve to moves on, this change should not
make anything slower.

Closes-bug: #1702728
Change-Id: Iabfdd3445117b898251782969c3d915b802f440e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the errored steps after they all responded

Removing steps during the initial loop could cause some issues and race
conditions.

This change makes it so the steps are filtered out after they all responded.
Since it waits for the global resolve to moves on, this change should not
make anything slower.

Closes-bug: #1702728
Change-Id: Iabfdd3445117b898251782969c3d915b802f440e

commit_message:
use net ip availability api def from neutron-lib

Commit I44451faa51b47e14ea17c60c035f3f497f00d7f6 add the network IP
availability extension's API definition to neutron-lib. This patch
consumes it by removing the extensions code that now lives in lib
as well as having the extension class inherit from the base
APIExtensionDescriptor class.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Iddfaaf01db05330109a9a3c10d05e02b6a2b9d09

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-06 17:37:15.000000000', 'files': ['roles/undercloud-setup/templates/vxlan_networking.sh.j2'], 'message': "Install openstack-selinux with openvswitch

Since openvswitch-2.8, some selinux policies installed
with openstack-selinux are required for openvswitch
services to start properly.

Funtion ovs_vxlan_bridge is used in multinode environments
to instal ovs in subnodes, so this patch is installing
openstack-selinux when installing openvswitch. Note that
selinux is not mandatory in ovs for non-openstack environments
so it can't be added as dependency in RPM.

Change-Id: I47832c2cd84247f0ee0e02208e95c051087c494a
"}]
commit_message:
Install openstack-selinux with openvswitch

Since openvswitch-2.8, some selinux policies installed
with openstack-selinux are required for openvswitch
services to start properly.

Funtion ovs_vxlan_bridge is used in multinode environments
to instal ovs in subnodes, so this patch is installing
openstack-selinux when installing openvswitch. Note that
selinux is not mandatory in ovs for non-openstack environments
so it can't be added as dependency in RPM.

Change-Id: I47832c2cd84247f0ee0e02208e95c051087c494a

commit_message:
Revert "Set ACLs on ceph client keyrings"

This reverts commit a4d12e02a7a44116aa8c7a327e14a09522a54b57.

There is a typo in the manilla relationship that causes failures.
Reverting for now to unblock scenario004. The typo should be fixed and
resubmitted.

Change-Id: I69f54418dd603e5819b9da483a04cea3b3f66231
Closes-Bug: #1731688

commit_message:
Increase the size of the Mistral output limit

This patch adds a new MistralExecutionFieldSizeLimit which
can be used to control the Mistral output limit.

Also, increases the default on the undercloud to 16MB.

Change-Id: If101566a22c7cce4af92c890cb9eb29e146b1599
Related-bug: #1718384

subject: Disable live migration over TLS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-11 10:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/libvirtd-tls-6de6fb35e0ac0ab1.yaml', 'docker/services/nova-libvirt.yaml'], 'message': "Disable live migration over TLS

Due to the fact that it doesn't use a separate CA (or sub CA) for
libvirtd, and that proper SASL is not being used. We are disabling this
option since it doesn't meet the appropriate security requirements.
We'll look into adding this back once these issues get fixed.

commit_message:
Disable live migration over TLS

Due to the fact that it doesn't use a separate CA (or sub CA) for
libvirtd, and that proper SASL is not being used. We are disabling this
option since it doesn't meet the appropriate security requirements.
We'll look into adding this back once these issues get fixed.

Change-Id: I6a5e4db1b6dd6bc8b7e73e53b614b070d15b8a23
Closes-Bug: #1730370
(cherry picked from commit 645757cbd6bdb1a1b75cb4aa8acce80a178099ce)

subject: Fix tempest scenario tests waiters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-11-08 10:30:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/test_listener_basic.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/base.py'], 'message': "Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0

subject: use new payload objects for *_INIT callbacks
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-08 09:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/neutron/services/trunk/driver.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'use new payload objects for *_INIT callbacks

Part of the work we did while rehoming the callback modules introduced
the notion of payload objects [1] to replace the unstructured kwargs
used today. When using payloads event sources need to use publish()
rather than notify() to trigger the callback(s) and pass along a payload
object (if needed).

This patch begins to move us onto the payload objects by updating
BEFORE_INIT and AFTER_INIT event types to use the payloads.

Depends-On: I9194c7857f10392149159071cda8e080e93adc10

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/doc/source/devref/callbacks.rst#event-payloads

Change-Id: I0485f4cf3c4eb9b0cbbe8245c48f322c0e807236
'}]
commit_message:
use new payload objects for *_INIT callbacks

Part of the work we did while rehoming the callback modules introduced
the notion of payload objects [1] to replace the unstructured kwargs
used today. When using payloads event sources need to use publish()
rather than notify() to trigger the callback(s) and pass along a payload
object (if needed).

This patch begins to move us onto the payload objects by updating
BEFORE_INIT and AFTER_INIT event types to use the payloads.

Depends-On: I9194c7857f10392149159071cda8e080e93adc10

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/doc/source/devref/callbacks.rst#event-payloads

Change-Id: I0485f4cf3c4eb9b0cbbe8245c48f322c0e807236

commit_message:
Replacing six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3* as well. And dict.items/keys will be more readable.

Change-Id: I3cd894253d6f5f9f39899dff678fd3fcf70ddc53

commit_message:
Removing reference of puppet-tempest

* As in tripleo deployment, we use python-tempestconf to generate
  tempest.conf. on setting enable_tempest to true it will auto
  install openstack-tempest so removing reference of puppet-tempest
  from it.

Change-Id: I65856cfbc8363394f5b01444fbb12f7e541aac1e

commit_message:
Update list of supported drivers, hardware types and their properties

* Add support for ilo, idrac, irmc and cisco-ucs-managed hardware types,
* Remove support for already removed SSH drivers
* Add pm_port support for ilo drivers
* Remove deprecated parameters for irmc and cisco-ucs-managed

Change-Id: Ie67f13db1f69888bac692a4e013224377740b969
Partial-Bug: #1690185

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-01 12:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/zaqar-api.yaml'], 'message': "Set notification_bind on zaqar websocket

Don't let zaqar websocket listen to notifications on all interfaces:
otherwise, it uses the hostname as a subscription target, and it doesn't
work when the host is set as an IPv6 host. Ultimately this should be
fixed in Zaqar, but this will work around it for now.

Change-Id: Ib7ece313371660ea02bef314bf5b5d2c4121a884
Related-Bug: #1727406
"}]
commit_message:
Set notification_bind on zaqar websocket

Don't let zaqar websocket listen to notifications on all interfaces:
otherwise, it uses the hostname as a subscription target, and it doesn't
work when the host is set as an IPv6 host. Ultimately this should be
fixed in Zaqar, but this will work around it for now.

Change-Id: Ib7ece313371660ea02bef314bf5b5d2c4121a884
Related-Bug: #1727406

commit_message:
Make Horizon parameters: vhost_extra_params and customization_module configurable

Horizon parameters - horizon::vhost_extra_params and horizon::customization_module
are available but not configurable using horizon. This change exposes these parameters
and makes them configurable.

Depends-On: Id204b60b2676f49713fb6ce7eede6200221f7163
Change-Id: I4875585530c6d1d3b1134577ef2e097216c6c348

commit_message:
Add missing vmware libs

Neutron and Cinder base images doesn't include the necessary
vmware libs. If we enable vmware nsx (nsxv or dvs) we need those
libraries to be available.

Closes-Bug: #1730662
Change-Id: I94005728fbce8320d7cf9d3b746978d8c7634ed5

commit_message:
Make sure /var/lib/mysql rights are setup correctly.

If you do an upgrade on then bootstrap[1] is not run, so you have to
make sure the permission are setup right every time.

This is duplicating what is happening in the pacemaker mysql template[2]

Partial-Bug: #1724636

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/database/mysql.yaml#L128
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/pacemaker/database/mysql.yaml#L162

Change-Id: Ib224dd10361171dfd579867be35a2c67a71fd9d5

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-14 20:22:27.000000000', 'files': ['manila/db/migrations/alembic/versions/829a09b0ddd4_fix_project_share_type_quotas_unique_constraint.py', 'manila/tests/db/migrations/alembic/migrations_data_checks.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_quotas.py'], 'message': "Fix 'project_share_type_quotas' DB table unique constraint

It should be possible to use share type quotas in each project/tenant.
But we get error trying to set share types quota in second+ project
for the same share type. It happens so due to the bug in DB schema,
where we don't have 'project_id' in unique constraint.
So, add new DB migration that fixes unique constraint and cover it with
DB and tempest tests.

Change-Id: I1405ced4e12b40904b7227c9f6285e2775005f8a
Closes-Bug: #1722707
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'project_share_type_quotas' DB table unique constraint

It should be possible to use share type quotas in each project/tenant.
But we get error trying to set share types quota in second+ project
for the same share type. It happens so due to the bug in DB schema,
where we don't have 'project_id' in unique constraint.
So, add new DB migration that fixes unique constraint and cover it with
DB and tempest tests.

Change-Id: I1405ced4e12b40904b7227c9f6285e2775005f8a
Closes-Bug: #1722707

commit_message:
Add cleanup checks in the upgrade doc

After the converge step, its sometimes necessary to run
a pcs resource cleanup to get a clean and working cluster
Adding that as a note at the end of the converge doc

Co-Authored-By: Athlan-Guyot Sofer <sathlang@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic60204bf66b179830e7f179ac67f5ed2558aef8a
Closes-bug: #1635231

subject: Using --option ARGUMENT
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-11-07 08:24:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/troubleshooting/troubleshooting-nodes.rst'], 'message': 'Using --option ARGUMENT

The OpenStack CLI commands support both --option ARGUMENT and --option=ARGUMENT.
In technical publications, use --option ARGUMENT.[1]

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: If20b264f98bf233b4aeae260645beb5bdabf0a8b
'}]
commit_message:
Using --option ARGUMENT

The OpenStack CLI commands support both --option ARGUMENT and --option=ARGUMENT.
In technical publications, use --option ARGUMENT.[1]

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/code-conventions.html

Change-Id: If20b264f98bf233b4aeae260645beb5bdabf0a8b

commit_message:
ironic: restructure the guide for clarity

* clearly split configuration and post-install guide, write introductions
* split configuration into essential and optional bits, add missing params
* shift emphasis to hardware types, mention advanced networking
* mention containers and a separate ironic-conductor role

A few small issues were also fixed.

Change-Id: I9a19b7e8a936ac8124c385f45224928db5ad3bd7

subject: Do not use “-y” for package install
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-08 07:34:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/multinode.rst', 'doc/source/install/developer/all-in-one.rst'], 'message': 'Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I002607baadb90c8b0da4332a9eb7ca8e6f598f9f
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use “-y” for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I002607baadb90c8b0da4332a9eb7ca8e6f598f9f

commit_message:
use project id api def from neutron-lib

The project ID extension's API defintion was rehomed into neutron-lib
with commit Ibe69134a35d2f2927b194c8353c26b41c55c6954
This patch consumes the API definition by removing the rehomed code
and using APIExtensionDescriptor for the extensions parent class.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Id6806dea66fb0462d3161651ddf6dfeee81368d4

commit_message:
Add entry for serviceaccount in flannel's values.yaml

The key for serviceaccount_flannel under manifests for flannel
was missing, resulting in failures when provisioning the kubeadm
aio with flannel

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-11-10 22:06:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/objects/common_types.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-security-group-protocol-by-numbers-48afb97ede961716.yaml', 'neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_common_types.py'], 'message': 'Support protocol numbers in security group API

Somewhere along the way we broke supporting numbers in
the security group API that were not in our known list
of protocols.  In order to fix this properly we must
use the correct arguments when using iptables-save, as
it could use a name instead of a number, or vice-versa.
Determined the list of mappings by doing:

 for num in {0..255}; do iptables -A INPUT -p $num; done
 # iptables-save

Change-Id: I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87
Closes-bug: #1716045
Closes-bug: #1716790
'}]
commit_message:
Support protocol numbers in security group API

Somewhere along the way we broke supporting numbers in
the security group API that were not in our known list
of protocols.  In order to fix this properly we must
use the correct arguments when using iptables-save, as
it could use a name instead of a number, or vice-versa.
Determined the list of mappings by doing:

 for num in {0..255}; do iptables -A INPUT -p $num; done
 # iptables-save

Change-Id: I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87
Closes-bug: #1716045
Closes-bug: #1716790

subject: Remove condition to match hdr(host) in haproxy redirect rule
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7010, 'name': "Ryan O'Hara", 'email': 'rohara@redhat.com', 'username': 'rohara'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-11-09 03:10:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Remove condition to match hdr(host) in haproxy redirect rule

The horizon proxy should redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS,
regardless of the 'Host' field in the header. The current rule will
cause haproxy to redirect HTTP requests if the 'Host' field contains
the public virtual IP address. It will not redirect if the 'Host'
field contains a hostname, FQDN, etc.

Change-Id: I6c8f58a30f97cdf4c668734793197ea976297733
Signed-off-by: Ryan O'Hara <rohara@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2606a4e66fa2802de604d56ade018119bebd79cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove condition to match hdr(host) in haproxy redirect rule

The horizon proxy should redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS,
regardless of the 'Host' field in the header. The current rule will
cause haproxy to redirect HTTP requests if the 'Host' field contains
the public virtual IP address. It will not redirect if the 'Host'
field contains a hostname, FQDN, etc.

Change-Id: I6c8f58a30f97cdf4c668734793197ea976297733
Signed-off-by: Ryan O'Hara <rohara@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2606a4e66fa2802de604d56ade018119bebd79cc)

commit_message:
Add missing host_prep_tasks for memcached

I missed this in change
Iecce2820657c5ad6bd2b02849c0433e5dce8009b. Memcached seems to be the
only service which mounts the /var/log/container/<service-name>
directory directly under /var/log in the container.

Change-Id: I26928bc7ad5f2f1bed60d200e8f2f0c310a14ee5
Partial-Bug: #1730957

commit_message:
Add option for panko container to log to stdout/stderr

This adds the option to get the panko container to log to stdout.
The option is disabled by default.

If enabled, It also adds a sidecar container that reads the apache
access logs.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: I56fa3de7427330c1d7bc10e0f8b1adbacec00e46

commit_message:
Add option for nova-libvirt container to log to stdout/stderr

This adds the option to get the nova-libvirt container to log to stdout.
The option is disabled by default.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: Ie769b4d93f3bd728b7efb84d283509db8213b5fc

These will be used in the undercloud to set up TLS everywhere.

Note that even though the novajoin-server and notifier have different
images in kolla. I'm enabling them via the same service entry. This is
because they'll be started as a "pod", so they need to be collocated.
